titleStmt.title: [Invoice] 1809 Mar.-Oct., The United States to Return J. Meigs, Agent to the Cherokee Nation : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Invoice] 1809 Mar.-Oct., The United States to Return J. Meigs, Agent to the Cherokee Nation
bibl.note: This document is an invoice dated 1809 from the United States to Return J. Meigs for services rendered as agent to the Cherokee Indians.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

table.head: The United States To Return J. Meigs__Dr. 1809

row.cell: March 25
To 14 days expences in obtaining money & on Journey to Nashville to pay Capt. G.C. Prussel Company 7th Regt. additional troops 150 cts pr day
To cash paid Eddington for his assistance 6 days & expences in bringing money---
To cash paid Berltain Goodwin for man & horse 3 days & expences in bringing money had in charge 5000 dollars-----
April 9th
To cash expended on a tour to Knoxville to pay Capt. Seviers Rifle Company 7 days @ 150 ct pr day
May 20th
To cash expended on a Journey to Knoxville to procure money 5 days at 120 cts pr day---
June 12th
To 51 days service in removing Intruders off Indian lands commencing 21st April ending June at 3$ pr day---
To expences for self & waiter with 2 horses @ 250 ct per
July 8th
To cash expended on a Journey to Knoxville to procure money 7 days with 2 horses @ 185 ct pr day
Augst 10th
To cash expended on 2 Journeys to Kingston to prosecute Shaffer & Drain charged with killing a Cherokee Indian, 9 days at 150 ct pr day---
Octor1st
To Salary for one year commencing 1st Octor 1808 ending 30th September 1809----at--
To 365 days rations 6 rations pr day 2190 rations at 16 cts...........
To 12 months forage for 1 horse at 6$ pr mo...
To the amount brot. over........
October 9th
To cash expended on a Journey to Knoxville to procure money for the Indian Department 10 days at 150 pr day...
Octor 23rd
To cash expended on a Journey to Knoxville to attend to the trial of Mahalalel Drain charged with killing a Cherokee Indian named Blackbird 9 days at 150...
